GPUQuerySet.summary: The GPUQuerySet interface of the {{domxref("WebGPU API", "WebGPU API", "", "nocode")}} is used to record the results of queries on passes, such as occlusion or timestamp queries.

blockquote.para: The timestamp-query feature needs to be enabled to use timestamp queries.

remarks.para: A GPUQuerySet object instance is created using the method.

GPUQuerySetLabel.summary:
The label property of the
interface is a string providing a label that can be used to identify the object, for example in messages or console warnings.

remarks.para: This can be set by providing a label property in the descriptor object passed into the originating call, or you can get and set it directly on the GPUQuerySet object.

GPUQuerySetLabel.value: A string. If this has not been previously set as described above, it will be an empty string.

GPUQuerySetDestroy.summary:
The destroy() method of the
interface destroys the GPUQuerySet.

GPUQuerySetCount.summary:
The count read-only property of the
interface is a number specifying the number of queries managed by the GPUQuerySet.

GPUQuerySetType.summary:
The type read-only property of the
interface is an enumerated value specifying the type of queries managed by the GPUQuerySet.
GPUQuerySetType.value:
An enumerated value. Possible values are:
NOTEThe timestamp-query feature needs to be enabled to use timestamp queries.
